text: I'm All Smiles is a live album by American jazz pianist Hampton Hawes recorded in 1966 but not released on the Contemporary label until 1973.Hampton Hawes discography, accessed June 25, 2015 ==Reception== The Allmusic review by Ron Wynn states "His phrasing and voicings could entice or amaze, and he displays great range, rhythmic vitality, and harmonic excellence during the five selections featured on this 1966 live date". ==Track listing== # "I'm All Smiles" (Michael Leonard, Herbert Martin) - 7:25 # "Manhã de Carnaval" (Luiz Bonfá, Antônio Maria) - 5:25 # "Spring Is Here" (Richard Rodgers, Lorenz Hart) - 5:04 # "The Shadow of Your Smile" (Johnny Mandel, Paul Francis Webster) - 9:55 # "Searchin'" (Hampton Hawes) - 10:22 ==Personnel== *Hampton Hawes - piano *Red Mitchell - bass *Donald Bailey - drums ==References== Category:Contemporary Records live albums Category:Hampton Hawes live albums Category:1973 live albums
title: I'm All Smiles (Hampton Hawes album)
